results.title: Mexico 75: no place else in the world to be
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Centre for the Study of Educational Communication and Media, LaTrobe University
results.brief_description: A record of the International Women’s Conference in Mexico City in 1975. The film sets the Conference in the context of an underdeveloped country and discusses the relevance of the women’s movement to third world countries. There is special emphasis on the contribution of the Australian delegation.

results.title: A Film for Discussion
results.creator_credit: Jeni Thornley, Martha Ansara and Sydney Women's Film Group
results.brief_description:
The Sydney Women’s Film Group was formed in 1971 by a small group of feminists who were troubled by the lack of options for women filmmakers in Australia, and appalled by the depiction of women in the media. The group produced and distributed films, held screenings and discussions, ran production workshops for women, and lobbied for women’s access to film funding and education. “Our aim was to further the spread of our revolutionary ideas through the visual media” (Jeni Thornley). Many of Australia’s women filmmakers owe their inspiration or start to this seminal group’s activities.

‘A Film for Discussion’ is the group’s first production, and is possibly the first feminist film made in Australia. The juxtaposition of experimental and realist sequences in the depiction of a ‘day in the life’ of an ordinary young woman, parallels the ‘personal is political’ ethos of 1970s feminism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeni Thornley, Martha Ansara and Sydney Women’s Film Group

results.title: The Cleaners
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead, Malcolm Wallhead Film Productions and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Opening with views of the city of Melbourne in the early morning, we see the crowds of workers arriving by train and tram. During the day the streets are crowded with people who dispose of rubbish without thought, necessitating an army of cleaners to keep the city clean. Day and night the cleaning goes on, in the early morning the main body of cleaners take over making the city ready for the day to come.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Wallhead, Malcolm Wallhead Film Productions and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: Jafar's blue tiles (Iran)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The restoration of a 600-year-old brick dome in his village is the focal point of fourteen-year-old Jafar’s interests and activities as he is seen making and installing twelve richly colored tiles that adorn the dome. Told from Jafar’s point of view, explains the significance of the project and the brickmaking process in the culture and customs of his country and captures vistas of the Iranian landscape.

results.title: Space flight
results.brief_description: Made by a special “Plasti-Cine” technique, in this film the hero, Dan, passes an amusing set of tests for health fitness, then flies a space rocket to the planet Venus. After battling the demon Nicotine, Dan persuades the Venusians to destroy the groves of cigarette trees to abolish smoking.

results.title: Gopal's golden pendant: India
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Looks at a family in Jaipur, India, whose members are master craftsmen in the art of enamelling gold and silver. In particular, the film focuses on a ten-year-old boy who has been learning the craft since he was six. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Kurtis: Hollywood stuntboy
results.creator_credit: Paul Quigley, Peter Rowe and Sunrise Films Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Kurtis Sanders is a 12 year old stuntman. The film shows stunts Kurtis and his family perform for a television special illustrating stuntwork. It also shows original footage of old westerns in which Kurtis’s grandfather was a stuntman.

results.title: Serama's mask
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Saltzman and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”
Serama, a Balinese boy, has been learning the intricate, ancient art of the Balinese dance since he was seven. His teacher is his father, a master dancer. They practice for a dance that will be the father’s final performance, and mark his son as his replacement.

results.title: Yoshiko the Papermaker (Japan)
results.creator_credit: Paul Saltzman, Deepa Mehta and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Yoshiko Fujimoto, thirteen, lives in the tiny mountain village of Obara-Mura which retains its seven hundred year old traditions for unique handmade paper panels. Yoshiko learns this ancient art from a local master.
